generic_uart_device: Generic UART Device (Raspberry Pi Pico W, Arduino, ESP32, etc.)
developer_affiliation: , Information Teacher at Songdo Middle School / Adjunct Professor at Inha University
app_description_2: ‚úÖ All MCUs such as Arduino, Micro:bit, ESP32, Raspberry Pi Pico are supported.

app_description_5: üöÄ Create AIoT applications by connecting various output devices to AI.
main_subtitle: Have a wonderful experience controlling hardware using vision AI.
main_description: You can control Micro:bit, Arduino, ESP32, RP Pico via wired and wireless connections.
tm_description: Control MCUs using image, pose, and sound models trained with Teachable Machine.
face_description: Control MCUs using MediaPipe's glabella coordinates, yawn, blink, face count, size, etc.
hand_description: Control MCUs using MediaPipe for index finger coordinates, thumb-index distance, counting, dual hands, etc.
voice_command_description: Control MCUs using voice recognition results from Google's Web Speech API.
mcu_guide_description: A guide to MCU coding and connection methods for developing intelligent objects linked with AI services.
service5_description: We are preparing a new artificial intelligence service.

tm_page_subtitle: Teachable Machine Integrated Interface - Image, Pose, Sound Recognition
guide_tm_2: Enter the model URL trained with Teachable Machine.
guide_tm_3: Select and connect your device (Serial or Bluetooth).
guide_tm_4: Load the model and press the Start button.
guide_tm_5: The recognized results are automatically sent to the MCU.
developer_info_tm: A web app that transmits TM results to wired/wireless MCUs using WebSerial and WebBLE.
developer_info_hardware_note: ‚öôÔ∏è Hardware requires prior code upload using block or text coding.
webcam_changed_alert: Webcam changed to '{webcamName}'. Stopping current operation.
right_click_blocked_alert: Source code copying is not allowed.
face_page_subtitle: Provides various functions using MediaPipe's face recognition technology.
guide_face_1: Select the desired face recognition feature from the top tabs.
guide_face_2: Click the 'Start Recognition' button to activate the camera.
guide_face_3: Connect your MCU device via Serial or Bluetooth.
guide_face_4: When a face is recognized, data is sent to the MCU in real-time.
guide_face_5: Utilize the received data on the MCU to control various output devices.
developer_affiliation_face: , Information Teacher at Songdo Middle School / Adjunct Professor at Inha University
developer_info_face: A web app that transmits face recognition results to wired/wireless MCUs using WebSerial and WebBLE.
developer_info_hardware_note_face: ‚öôÔ∏è Hardware requires prior code upload using block or text coding.
hand_page_subtitle: Provides various functions using MediaPipe's hand recognition technology.
thumb_index_dist: Distance between Thumb and Index Finger
guide_hand_1: Select the desired hand recognition feature from the top tabs.
guide_hand_2: Click the 'Start Recognition' button to activate the camera.
guide_hand_3: Connect your MCU device via Serial or Bluetooth.
guide_hand_4: When a hand is recognized, data is sent to the MCU in real-time.
guide_hand_5: Utilize the received data on the MCU to control various output devices.
developer_info_hand: A web app that transmits hand recognition results to wired/wireless MCUs using WebSerial and WebBLE.
voice_page_subtitle: Control MCUs by voice using the Google Web Speech API.
guide_voice_2: Press '+' to set the word to recognize and the value to send to the MCU (max 20).
guide_voice_3: Connect the device you want to control via Serial or Bluetooth.
guide_voice_4: Press 'Start Recognition' and speak, including the set word.
guide_voice_5: When the word is recognized, its field will be highlighted in red, and the set value will be sent automatically.
developer_info_voice: A web app that transmits voice recognition results to wired/wireless MCUs using the Web Speech API.
browser_not_supported_alert: This browser does not support speech recognition. Please use Chrome.
max_commands_alert: You can add a maximum of 20 commands.
guide_page_subtitle: A guide on how to connect MCUs with TM, Face, Hand, and Voice recognition services.
